page.title: 09COMMUNICATIONS: TRANSPORT.
page.content: As this block is primarily agricultural land, there is only one main road passing through it: the A 161 which takes traffic from Gainsborough in the South and Goole in the North. Although much of the traffic for the docks of Goole now uses the Motorway route, the road still carries a lot of traffic between towns and villages along the '161' and on its way to Scunthorpe or Doncaster. Off the A 161 there is also a network of agricultural by-roads maintained by Boothferry Borough Council. It provides an invaluable link for the farmers between their fields and the main roads and transport routes(it is only three miles to the M180). The railway link through this block was axed in the '60s by Dr Beaching.
